تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ كُلَّمَآ أُلْقِىَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ (8)
Almost bursting for fury. Whenever a group is cast into it, its keeper shall ask them: Did there not come to you a warner?
قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَٰلٍ كَبِيرٍ (9)
They shall say: Yea! indeed there came to us a warner, but we rejected (him) and said: Allah has not revealed anything, you are only in a great error.
وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِىٓ أَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ (10)
And they shall say: Had we but listened or pondered, we should not have been among the inmates of the burning fire.
فَٱعْتَرَفُوا۟ بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِّأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ (11)
So they shall acknowledge their sins, but far will be (forgiveness) from the inmates of the burning fire.
إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ (12)
(As for) those who fear their Lord in secret, they shall surely have forgiveness and a great reward.
وَأَسِرُّوا۟ قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ ٱجْهَرُوا۟ بِهِۦٓ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ (13)
And conceal your word or manifest it; surely He is Cognizant of what is in the hearts.
أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ (14)
Does He not know, Who created? And He is the Knower of the subtleties, the Aware.
هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَٱمْشُوا۟ فِى مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِهِۦ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ (15)
He it is Who made the earth smooth for you, therefore go about in the spacious sides thereof, and eat of His sustenance, and to Him is the return after death.
ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَمُورُ (16)
Are you secure of those in the heaven that He should not make the earth to swallow you up? Then lo! it shall be in a state of commotion.
أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ (17)
Or are you secure of those in the heaven that He should not send down upon you a punishment? Then shall you know how was My warning.
وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ (18)
And certainly those before them rejected (the truth), then how was My disapproval.
أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَٰٓفَّٰتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۭ بَصِيرٌ (19)
Have they not seen the birds above them expanding (their wings) and contracting (them)? What is it that withholds them save the Beneficent Allah? Surely He sees everything.
أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ جُندٌ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ إِنِ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِى غُرُورٍ (20)
Or who is it that will be a host for you to assist you besides the Beneficent Allah? The unbelievers are only in deception.
أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُۥ بَل لَّجُّوا۟ فِى عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ (21)
Or who is it that will give you sustenance if He should withhold His sustenance? Nay! they persist in disdain and aversion.
أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦٓ أَهْدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ (22)
What! is he who goes prone upon his face better guided or he who walks upright upon a straight path?
قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ (23)
Say: He it is Who brought you into being and made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts: little is it that you give thanks.
قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ (24)
Say: He it is Who multiplied you in the earth and to Him you shall be gathered.
وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ (25)
And they say: When shall this threat be (executed) if you are truthful?
قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْعِلْمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ (26)
Say: The knowledge (thereof is only with Allah and I am only a plain warner.
فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيٓـَٔتْ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ (27)
But when they shall see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve shall be sorry, and it shall be said; This is that which you used to call for.
قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِىَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ (28)
Say: Have you considered if Allah should destroy me and those with me-- rather He will have mercy on us; yet who will protect the unbelievers from a painful punishment?
قُلْ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ (29)
Say: He is the Beneficent Allah, we believe in Him and on Him do we rely, so you shall come to know who it is that is in clear error.
قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِينٍۭ (30)
Say: Have you considered if your water should go down, who is it then that will bring you flowing water?

A72.Title: 68: Al-Qalam القلم
A72.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
نٓ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ (1)
Noon. I swear by the pen and what the angels write,
مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ (2)
By the grace of your Lord you are not mad.
وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ (3)
And most surely you shall have a reward never to be cut off.
وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ (4)
And most surely you conform (yourself) to sublime morality.
فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ (5)
So you shall see, and they (too) shall see,
بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ (6)
Which of you is afflicted with madness.
إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ (7)
Surely your Lord best knows him who errs from His way, and He best knows the followers of the right course.
فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (8)
So do not yield to the rejecters.
وَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ (9)
They wish that you should be pliant so they (too) would be pliant.
وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ (10)
And yield not to any mean swearer
هَمَّازٍ مَّشَّآءٍۭ بِنَمِيمٍ (11)
Defamer, going about with slander
مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ (12)
Forbidder of good, outstepping the limits, sinful,
عُتُلٍّۭ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ (13)
Ignoble, besides all that, base-born;
أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ (14)
Because he possesses wealth and sons.
إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ (15)
When Our communications are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore.
سَنَسِمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْخُرْطُومِ (16)
We will brand him on the nose.
إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ (17)
Surely We will try them as We tried the owners of the garden, when they swore that they would certainly cut off the produce in the morning,
وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ (18)
And were not willing to set aside a portion (for the poor).
فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ (19)
Then there encompassed it a visitation from your Lord while they were sleeping.
فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَٱلصَّرِيمِ (20)
So it became as black, barren land.
فَتَنَادَوْا۟ مُصْبِحِينَ (21)
And they called out to each other in the morning,
أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ (22)
Saying: Go early to your tilth if you would cut (the produce).
فَٱنطَلَقُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَتَخَٰفَتُونَ (23)
So they went, while they consulted together secretly,
أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ (24)
Saying: No poor man shall enter it today upon you.
وَغَدَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَٰدِرِينَ (25)
And in the morning they went, having the power to prevent.
فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لَضَآلُّونَ (26)
But when they saw it, they said: Most surely we have gone astray
بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ (27)
Nay! we are made to suffer privation.
قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ (28)
The best of them said: Did I not say to you, Why do you not glorify (Allah)?
قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ (29)
They said: Glory be to our Lord, surely we were unjust.
فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَٰوَمُونَ (30)
Then some of them advanced against others, blaming each other.
قَالُوا۟ يَٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَٰغِينَ (31)
Said they: O woe to us! surely we were inordinate:
عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ (32)
Maybe, our Lord will give us instead one better than it; surely to our Lord do we make our humble petition.
كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ (33)
Such is the chastisement, and certainly the chastisement of the hereafter is greater, did they but know!
إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ (34)
Surely those who guard (against evil) shall have with their Lord gardens of bliss.
أَفَنَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ (35)
What! shall We then make (that is, treat) those who submit as the guilty?
مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ (36)
What has happened to you? How do you judge?
أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَٰبٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ (37)
Or have you a book wherein you read,
إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ (38)
That you have surely therein what you choose?
أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ (39)
Or have you received from Us an agreement confirmed by an oath extending to the day of resurrection that you shall surely have what you demand?
سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ (40)
Ask them which of them will vouch for that,
أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ (41)
Or have they associates if they are truthful.
يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ (42)
On the day when there shall be a severe affliction, and they shall be called upon to make obeisance, but they shall not be able,
خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَٰلِمُونَ (43)
Their looks cast down, abasement shall overtake them; and they were called upon to make obeisance indeed while yet they were safe.
فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ (44)
So leave Me and him who rejects this announcement; We will overtake them by degrees, from whence they perceive not:
وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ (45)
And I do bear with them, surely My plan is firm.
أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ (46)
Or do you ask from them a reward, so that they are burdened with debt?
أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ (47)
Or have they (the knowledge of) the unseen, so that they write (it) down?
فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ (48)
So wait patiently for the judgment of your Lord, and be not like the companion of the fish, when he cried while he was in distress.
لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ (49)
Were it not that favor from his Lord had overtaken him, he would certainly have been cast down upon the naked Found while he was blamed.
فَٱجْتَبَٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ (50)
Then his Lord chose him, and He made him of the good.
وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ (51)
And those who disbelieve would almost smite you with their eyes when they hear the reminder, and they say: Most surely he is mad.
وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَٰلَمِينَ (52)
And it is naught but a reminder to the nations.

A73.Title: 69: Al-Haaqqa الحاقة
A73.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
ٱلْحَآقَّةُ (1)
The sure calamity!
مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ (2)
What is the sure calamity!
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ (3)
And what would make you realize what the sure calamity is!
كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ (4)
Samood and Ad called the striking calamity a lie.
فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ (5)
Then as to Samood, they were destroyed by an excessively severe punishment.
وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ (6)
And as to Ad, they were destroyed by a roaring, violent blast.
سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ (7)
Which He made to prevail against them for seven nights and eight days unremittingly, so that you might have seen the people therein prostrate as if they were the trunks of hollow palms.
فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍ (8)
Do you then see of them one remaining?
وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ (9)
And Firon and those before him and the overthrown cities continuously committed sins.
فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً (10)
And they disobeyed the Apostle of their Lord, so He punished them with a vehement punishment.
إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ (11)
Surely We bore you up in the ship when the water rose high,
لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ (12)
So that We may make it a reminder to you, and that the retaining ear might retain it.
فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ (13)
And when the trumpet is blown with a single blast,
وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً (14)
And the earth and the mountains are borne away and crushed with a single crushing.
فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ (15)
On that day shall the great event come to pass,
وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِىَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ (16)
And the heaven shall cleave asunder, so that on that day it shall be frail,
وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَٰنِيَةٌ (17)
And the angels shall be on the sides thereof; and above them eight shall bear on that day your Lord's power.
يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ (18)
On that day you shall be exposed to view-- no secret of yours shall remain hidden.
فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَٰبِيَهْ (19)
Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: Lo! read my book:
إِنِّى ظَنَنتُ أَنِّى مُلَٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ (20)
Surely I knew that I shall meet my account.
فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ (21)
So he shall be in a life of pleasure,
فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ (22)
In a lofty garden,
قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ (23)
The fruits of which are near at hand:
كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ (24)
Eat and drink pleasantly for what you did beforehand in the days gone by.
وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهْ (25)
And as for him who is given his book in his left hand he shall say: O would that my book had never been given me:
وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ (26)
And I had not known what my account was:
يَٰلَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلْقَاضِيَةَ (27)
O would that it had made an end (of me):
مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّى مَالِيَهْ (28)
My wealth has availed me nothing:
هَلَكَ عَنِّى سُلْطَٰنِيَهْ (29)
My authority is gone away from me.
خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ (30)
Lay hold on him, then put a chain on him,
ثُمَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ (31)
Then cast him into the burning fire,
ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ (32)
Then thrust him into a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.
إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ (33)
Surely he did not believe in Allah, the Great,
وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ (34)
Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
فَلَيْسَ لَهُ ٱلْيَوْمَ هَٰهُنَا حَمِيمٌ (35)
Therefore he has not here today a true friend,
وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ (36)
Nor any food except refuse,
لَّا يَأْكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْخَٰطِـُٔونَ (37)
Which none but the wrongdoers eat.
فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ (38)
But nay! I swear by that which you see,
وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ (39)
And that which you do not see.
إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ (40)
Most surely, it is the Word brought by an honored Apostle,
وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ (41)
And it is not the word of a poet; little is it that you believe;
وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ (42)
Nor the word of a soothsayer; little is it that you mind.
تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ (43)
It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلْأَقَاوِيلِ (44)
And if he had fabricated against Us some of the sayings,
لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِٱلْيَمِينِ (45)
We would certainly have seized him by the right hand,
ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ (46)
Then We would certainly have cut off his aorta.
فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَٰجِزِينَ (47)
And not one of you could have withheld Us from him.
وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ (48)
And most surely it is a reminder for those who guard (against evil).
وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ (49)
And most surely We know that some of you are rejecters.
وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ (50)
And most surely it is a great grief to the unbelievers.
وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ (51)
And most surely it is the true certainty
فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ (52)
Therefore-glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

A74.Title: 70: Al-Ma'aarij المعارج
A74.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ (1)
One demanding, demanded the chastisement which must befall
لِّلْكَٰفِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٌ (2)
The unbelievers-- there is none to avert it--
مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِى ٱلْمَعَارِجِ (3)
From Allah, the Lord of the ways of Ascent.
تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ (4)
To Him ascend the angels and the Spirit in a day the measure of which is fifty thousand years.
فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا (5)
Therefore endure with a goodly patience.
إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُۥ بَعِيدًا (6)
Surely they think it to be far off,
وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبًا (7)
And We see it nigh.
يَوْمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلْمُهْلِ (8)
On the day when the heaven shall be as molten copper
وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ (9)
And the mountains shall be as tufts of wool
وَلَا يَسْـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا (10)
And friend shall not ask of friend
يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ (11)
(Though) they shall be made to see each other. The guilty one would fain redeem himself from the chastisement of that day by (sacrificing) his children,
وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ (12)
And his wife and his brother
وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِى تُـْٔوِيهِ (13)
And the nearest of his kinsfolk who gave him shelter,
وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ (14)
And all those that are in the earth, (wishing) then (that) this might deliver him.
كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ (15)
By no means! Surely it is a flaming fire
نَزَّاعَةً لِّلشَّوَىٰ (16)
Dragging by the head,
تَدْعُوا۟ مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ (17)
It shall claim him who turned and fled (from truth),
وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰٓ (18)
And amasses (wealth) then shuts it up.
إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا (19)
Surely man is created of a hasty temperament
إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا (20)
Being greatly grieved when evil afflicts him
وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا (21)
And niggardly when good befalls him
إِلَّا ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ (22)
Except those who pray,
ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَآئِمُونَ (23)
Those who are constant at their prayer
وَٱلَّذِينَ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ (24)
And those in whose wealth there is a fixed portion.
لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ (25)
For him who begs and for him who is denied (good)
وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ (26)
And those who accept the truth of the judgment day
وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ (27)
And those who are fearful of the chastisement of their Lord--
إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ (28)
Surely the chastisement of their Lord is (a thing) not to be felt secure of--
وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَٰفِظُونَ (29)
And those who guard their private parts,
إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ (30)
Except in the case of their wives or those whom their right hands possess-- for these surely are not to be blamed,
فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ (31)
But he who seeks to go beyond this, these it is that go beyond the limits--
وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ (32)
And those who are faithful to their trusts and their covenant
وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَٰدَٰتِهِمْ قَآئِمُونَ (33)
And those who are upright in their testimonies,
وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ (34)
And those who keep a guard on their prayer,
أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ فِى جَنَّٰتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ (35)
Those shall be in gardens, honored.
فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ (36)
But what is the matter with those who disbelieve that they hasten on around you,
عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ (37)
On the right hand and on the left, in sundry parties?
أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ (38)
Does every man of them desire that he should be made to enter the garden of bliss?
كَلَّآ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ (39)
By no means! Surely We have created them of what they know.
فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ (40)
But nay! I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are certainly able
عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ (41)
To bring instead (others) better than them, and We shall not be overcome.
فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ (42)
Therefore leave them alone to go on with the false discourses and to sport until they come face to face with that day of theirs with which they are threatened;
يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ (43)
The day on which they shall come forth from their graves in haste, as if they were hastening on to a goal,
خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ (44)
Their eyes cast down; disgrace shall overtake them; that is the day which they were threatened with.

A75.Title: 71: Nooh نوح
A75.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ (1)
Surely We sent Nuh to his people, saying: Warn your people before there come upon them a painful chastisement.
قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ (2)
He said: O my people! Surely I am a plain warner to you:
أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ (3)
That you should serve Allah and be careful of (your duty to) Him and obey me:
يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ (4)
He will forgive you some of your faults and grant you a delay to an appointed term; surely the term of Allah when it comes is not postponed; did you but know!
قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا (5)
He said: O my Lord! surely I have called my people by night and by day!
فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا (6)
But my call has only made them flee the more:
وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا (7)
And whenever I have called them that Thou mayest forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, cover themselves with their garments, and persist and are puffed up with pride:
ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا (8)
Then surely I called to them aloud:
ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا (9)
Then surely I spoke to them in public and I spoke to them in secret:
فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا (10)
Then I said, Ask forgiveness of your Lord, surely He is the most Forgiving:
يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا (11)
He will send down upon you the cloud, pouring down abundance of rain:
وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَٰرًا (12)
And help you with wealth and sons, and make for you gardens, and make for you rivers.
مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا (13)
What is the matter with you that you fear not the greatness of Allah?
وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا (14)
And indeed He has created you through various grades:
أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا (15)
Do you not see how Allah has created the seven heavens, one above another,
وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا (16)
And made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp?
وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا (17)
And Allah has made you grow out of the earth as a growth:
ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا (18)
Then He returns you to it, then will He bring you forth a (new) bringing forth:
وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا (19)
And Allah has made for you the earth a wide expanse,
لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا (20)
That you may go along therein in wide paths.
قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا (21)
Nuh said: My Lord! surely they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children have added to him nothing but loss.
وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا (22)
And they have planned a very great plan.
وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا (23)
And they say: By no means leave your gods, nor leave Wadd, nor Suwa; nor Yaghus, and Yauq and Nasr.
وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًا وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلًا (24)
And indeed they have led astray many, and do not increase the unjust in aught but error.
مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا (25)
Because of their wrongs they were drowned, then made to enter fire, so they did not find any helpers besides Allah.
وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا (26)
And Nuh said: My Lord! leave not upon the land any dweller from among the unbelievers:
إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا (27)
For surely if Thou leave them they will lead astray Thy servants, and will not beget any but immoral, ungrateful (children)
رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا (28)
My Lord! forgive me and my parents and him who enters my house believing, and the believing men and the believing women; and do not increase the unjust in aught but destruction!

A76.Title: 72: Al-Jinn الجن
A76.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا (1)
Say: It has been revealed to me that a party of the jinn listened, and they said: Surely we have heard a wonderful Quran,
يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا (2)
Guiding to the right way, so we believe in it, and we will not set up any one with our Lord:
وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا (3)
And that He-- exalted be the majesty of our Lord-- has not taken a consort, nor a son:
وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا (4)
And that the foolish amongst us used to forge extravagant things against Allah:
وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا (5)
And that we thought that men and jinn did not utter a lie against Allah:
وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا (6)
And that persons from among men used to seek refuge with persons from among jinn, so they increased them in wrongdoing:
وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا (7)
And that they thought as you think, that Allah would not raise anyone:
وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا (8)
And that we sought to reach heaven, but we found it filled with strong guards and flaming stars.
وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْءَانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا (9)
And that we used to sit in some of the sitting-places thereof to steal a hearing, but he who would (try to) listen now would find a flame lying in wait for him:
وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا (10)
And that we know not whether evil is meant for those who are on earth or whether their Lord means to bring them good:
وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًا (11)
And that some of us are good and others of us are below that: we are sects following different ways:
وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًا (12)
And that we know that we cannot escape Allah in the earth, nor can we escape Him by flight:
وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا (13)
And that when we heard the guidance, we believed in it; so whoever believes in his Lord, he should neither fear loss nor being overtaken (by disgrace):
وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا۟ رَشَدًا (14)
And that some of us are those who submit, and some of us are the deviators; so whoever submits, these aim at the right way:
وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا (15)
And as to the deviators, they are fuel of hell:
وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًا (16)
And that if they should keep to the (right) way, We would certainly give them to drink of abundant water,
لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا (17)
So that We might try them with respect to it; and whoever turns aside from the reminder of his Lord, He will make him enter into an afflicting chastisement:
وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًا (18)
And that the mosques are Allah's, therefore call not upon any one with Allah:
وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا (19)
And that when the servant of Allah stood up calling upon Him, they wellnigh crowded him (to death).
قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا (20)
Say: I only call upon my Lord, and I do not associate any one with Him.
قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا (21)
Say: I do not control for you evil or good.
قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا (22)
Say: Surely no one can protect me against Allah, nor can I find besides Him any place of refuge:
إِلَّا بَلَٰغًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا (23)
(It is) only a delivering (of communications) from Allah and His messages; and whoever disobeys Allah and His Apostle surely he shall have the fire of hell to abide therein for a long time.
حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا (24)
Until when they see what they are threatened with, then shall they know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.
قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا (25)
Say: I do not know whether that with which you are threatened be nigh or whether my Lord will appoint for it a term:
عَٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا (26)
The Knower of the unseen! so He does not reveal His secrets to any,
إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًا (27)
Except to him whom He chooses as an apostle; for surely He makes a guard to march before him and after him,
لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا۟ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدًۢا (28)
So that He may know that they have truly delivered the messages of their Lord, and He encompasses what is with them and He records the number of all things.

A77.Title: 73: Al-Muzzammil المزمل
A77.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ (1)
O you who have wrapped up in your garments!
قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا (2)
Rise to pray in the night except a little,
نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا (3)
Half of it, or lessen it a little,
أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا (4)
Or add to it, and recite the Quran as it ought to be recited.
إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا (5)
Surely We will make to light upon you a weighty Word.
إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا (6)
Surely the rising by night is the firmest way to tread and the best corrective of speech.
إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا (7)
Surely you have in the day time a long occupation.
وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا (8)
And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with (exclusive) devotion.
رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا (9)
The Lord of the East and the West-- there is no god but He-- therefore take Him for a protector.
وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا (10)
And bear patiently what they say and avoid them with a becoming avoidance.
وَذَرْنِى وَٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُو۟لِى ٱلنَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا (11)
And leave Me and the rejecters, the possessors of ease and plenty, and respite them a little.
إِنَّ لَدَيْنَآ أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا (12)
Surely with Us are heavy fetters and a flaming fire,
وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا (13)
And food that chokes and a painful punishment,
يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا (14)
On the day when the earth and the mountains shall quake and the mountains shall become (as) heaps of sand let loose.
إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا (15)
Surely We have sent to you an Apostle, a witness against you, as We sent an apostle to Firon.
فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَٰهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا (16)
But Firon disobeyed the apostle, so We laid on him a violent hold.
فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ ٱلْوِلْدَٰنَ شِيبًا (17)
How, then, will you guard yourselves, if you disbelieve, on the day which shall make children grey-headed?
ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرٌۢ بِهِۦ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَفْعُولًا (18)
The heaven shall rend asunder thereby; His promise is ever brought to fulfillment.
إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا (19)
Surely this is a reminder, then let him, who will take the way to his Lord.
إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٌ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌۢ (20)
Surely your Lord knows that you pass in prayer nearly two-thirds of the night, and (sometimes) half of it, and (sometimes) a third of it, and (also) a party of those with you; and Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you are not able to do it, so He has turned to you (mercifully), therefore read what is easy of the Quran. He knows that there must be among you sick, and others who travel in the land seeking of the bounty of Allah, and others who fight in Allah's way, therefore read as much of it as is easy (to you), and keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate and offer to Allah a goodly gift, and whatever of good you send on beforehand for yourselves, you will find it with Allah; that is best and greatest in reward; and ask forgiveness of Allah; surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

A78.Title: 74: Al-Muddaththir المدثر
A78.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ (1)
O you who are clothed!
قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ (2)
Arise and warn,
وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ (3)
And your Lord do magnify,
وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ (4)
And your garments do purify,
وَٱلرُّجْزَ فَٱهْجُرْ (5)
And uncleanness do shun,
وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ (6)
And bestow not favors that you may receive again with increase,
وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصْبِرْ (7)
And for the sake of your Lord, be patient.
فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِى ٱلنَّاقُورِ (8)
For when the trumpet is sounded,
فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ (9)
That, at that time, shall be a difficult day,
عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ (10)
For the unbelievers, anything but easy.
ذَرْنِى وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا (11)
Leave Me and him whom I created alone,
وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُۥ مَالًا مَّمْدُودًا (12)
And give him vast riches,
وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا (13)
And sons dwelling in his presence,
وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمْهِيدًا (14)
And I adjusted affairs for him adjustably;
ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ (15)
And yet he desires that I should add more!
كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِءَايَٰتِنَا عَنِيدًا (16)
By no means! surely he offers opposition to Our communications.
سَأُرْهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا (17)
I will make a distressing punishment overtake him.
إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ (18)
Surely he reflected and guessed,
فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ (19)
But may he be cursed how he plotted;
ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ (20)
Again, may he be cursed how he plotted;
ثُمَّ نَظَرَ (21)
Then he looked,
ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ (22)
Then he frowned and scowled,
ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ (23)
Then he turned back and was big with pride,
فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ (24)
~Then he said: This is naught but enchantment, narrated (from others);
إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوْلُ ٱلْبَشَرِ (25)
This is naught but the word of a mortal.
سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ (26)
I will cast him into hell.
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ (27)
And what will make you realize what hell is?
لَا تُبْقِى وَلَا تَذَرُ (28)
It leaves naught nor does it spare aught.
لَوَّاحَةٌ لِّلْبَشَرِ (29)
It scorches the mortal.
عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ (30)
Over it are nineteen.
وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةً وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَٰنًا وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ (31)
And We have not made the wardens of the fire others than angels, and We have not made their number but as a trial for those who disbelieve, that those who have been given the book may be certain and those who believe may increase in faith, and those who have been given the book and the believers may not doubt, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the unbelievers may say: What does Allah mean by this parable? Thus does Allah make err whom He pleases, and He guides whom He pleases, and none knows the hosts of your Lord but He Himself; and this is naught but a reminder to the mortals.
كَلَّا وَٱلْقَمَرِ (32)
Nay; I swear by the moon,
وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ (33)
And the night when it departs,
وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَآ أَسْفَرَ (34)
And the daybreak when it shines;
إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى ٱلْكُبَرِ (35)
Surely it (hell) is one of the gravest (misfortunes),
نَذِيرًا لِّلْبَشَرِ (36)
A warning to mortals,
لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ (37)
To him among you who wishes to go forward or remain behind.
كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ (38)
Every soul is held in pledge for what it earns,
إِلَّآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْيَمِينِ (39)
Except the people of the right hand,
فِى جَنَّٰتٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ (40)
In gardens, they shall ask each other
عَنِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ (41)
About the guilty:
مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِى سَقَرَ (42)
What has brought you into hell?
قَالُوا۟ لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ (43)
They shall say: We were not of those who prayed;
وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ ٱلْمِسْكِينَ (44)
And we used not to feed the poor;
وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلْخَآئِضِينَ (45)
And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who entered into vain discourses.
وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ (46)
And we used to call the day of judgment a lie;
حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلْيَقِينُ (47)
Till death overtook us.
فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ (48)
So the intercession of intercessors shall not avail them.
فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلتَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ (49)
What is then the matter with them, that they turn away from the admonition
كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُّسْتَنفِرَةٌ (50)
As if they were asses taking fright
فَرَّتْ مِن قَسْوَرَةٍۭ (51)
That had fled from a lion?
بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً (52)
Nay; every one of them desires that he may be given pages spread out;
كَلَّا بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ (53)
Nay! but they do not fear the hereafter.
كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذْكِرَةٌ (54)
Nay! it is surely an admonition.
فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ (55)
So whoever pleases may mind it.
وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن ��َشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ (56)
And they will not mind unless Allah please. He is worthy to be feared and worthy to forgive.

A79.Title: 75: Al-Qiyaama القيامة
A79.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ (1)
Nay! I swear by the day of resurrection.
وَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلنَّفْسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ (2)
Nay! I swear by the self-accusing soul.
أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ (3)
Does man think that We shall not gather his bones?
بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ (4)
Yea! We are able to make complete his very fingertips
بَلْ يُرِيدُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ (5)
Nay! man desires to give the lie to what is before him.
يَسْـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ (6)
He asks: When is the day of resurrection?
فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلْبَصَرُ (7)
So when the sight becomes dazed,
وَخَسَفَ ٱلْقَمَرُ (8)
And the moon becomes dark,
وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ (9)
And the sun and the moon are brought together,
يَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ ٱلْمَفَرُّ (10)
Man shall say on that day: Whither to fly to?
كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ (11)
By no means! there shall be no place of refuge!
إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمُسْتَقَرُّ (12)
With your Lord alone shall on that day be the place of rest.
يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ (13)
Man shall on that day be informed of what he sent before and (what he) put off.
بَلِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٌ (14)
Nay! man is evidence against himself,
وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ (15)
Though he puts forth his excuses.
لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ (16)
Do not move your tongue with it to make haste with it,
إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُۥ وَقُرْءَانَهُۥ (17)
Surely on Us (devolves) the collecting of it and the reciting of it.
فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعْ قُرْءَانَهُۥ (18)
Therefore when We have recited it, follow its recitation.
ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُۥ (19)
Again on Us (devolves) the explaining of it.
كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ (20)
Nay! But you love the present life,
وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ (21)
And neglect the hereafter.
وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاضِرَةٌ (22)
(Some) faces on that day shall be bright,
إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ (23)
Looking to their Lord.
وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَاسِرَةٌ (24)
And (other) faces on that day shall be gloomy,
تَظُنُّ أَن يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ (25)
Knowing that there will be made to befall them some great calamity.
كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِىَ (26)
Nay! When it comes up to the throat,
وَقِيلَ مَنْ رَاقٍ (27)
And it is said: Who will be a magician?
وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلْفِرَاقُ (28)
And he is sure that it is the (hour of) parting
وَٱلْتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ (29)
And affliction is combined with affliction;
إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمَسَاقُ (30)
To your Lord on that day shall be the driving.
فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ (31)
So he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray,
وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ (32)
But called the truth a lie and turned back,
ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ (33)
Then he went to his followers, walking away in haughtiness.
أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ (34)
Nearer to you (is destruction) and nearer,
ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰٓ (35)
Again (consider how) nearer to you and nearer.
أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتْرَكَ سُدًى (36)
Does man think that he is to be left to wander without an aim?
أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِّن مَّنِىٍّ يُمْنَىٰ (37)
Was he not a small seed in the seminal elements,
ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ (38)
Then he was a clot of blood, so He created (him) then made (him) perfect.
فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ (39)
Then He made of him two kinds, the male and the female.
أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْۦِىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ (40)
Is not He able to give life to the dead?

A80.Title: 76: Al-Insaan الانسان
A80.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا (1)
There surely came over man a period of time when he was a thing not worth mentioning.
إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا (2)
Surely We have created man from a small life-germ uniting (itself): We mean to try him, so We have made him hearing, seeing.
إِنَّا هَدَيْنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا (3)
Surely We have shown him the way: he may be thankful or unthankful.
إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَٰلًا وَسَعِيرًا (4)
Surely We have prepared for the unbelievers chains and shackles and a burning fire.
إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا (5)
Surely the righteous shall drink of a cup the admixture of which is camphor
عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا (6)
A fountain from which the servants of Allah shall drink; they make it to flow a (goodly) flowing forth.
يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًا (7)
They fulfill vows and fear a day the evil of which shall be spreading far and wide.
وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا (8)
And they give food out of love for Him to the poor and the orphan and the captive:
إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءً وَلَا شُكُورًا (9)
We only feed you for Allah's sake; we desire from you neither reward nor thanks:
إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا (10)
Surely we fear from our Lord a stern, distressful day.
فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا (11)
Therefore Allah win guard them from the evil of that day and cause them to meet with ease and happiness;
وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا (12)
And reward them, because they were patient, with garden and silk,
مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا (13)
Reclining therein on raised couches, they shall find therein neither (the severe heat of) the sun nor intense cold.
وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا (14)
And close down upon them (shall be) its shadows, and its fruits shall be made near (to them), being easy to reach.
وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠ (15)
And there shall be made to go round about them vessels of silver and goblets which are of glass,
قَوَارِيرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا (16)
(Transparent as) glass, made of silver; they have measured them according to a measure.
وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا (17)
And they shall be made to drink therein a cup the admixture of which shall be ginger,
عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا (18)
(Of) a fountain therein which is named Salsabil.
وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا (19)
And round about them shall go youths never altering in age; when you see them you will think them to be scattered pearls.
وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا (20)
And when you see there, you shall see blessings and a great kingdom.
عَٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا (21)
Upon them shall be garments of fine green silk and thick silk interwoven with gold, and they shall be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord shall make them drink a pure drink.
إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا (22)
Surely this is a reward for you, and your striving shall be recompensed.
إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًا (23)
Surely We Ourselves have revealed the Quran to you revealing (it) in portions.
فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا (24)
Therefore wait patiently for the command of your Lord, and obey not from among them a sinner or an ungrateful one.
وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا (25)
And glorify the name of your Lord morning and evening.
وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا (26)
And during part of the night adore Him, and give glory to Him (a) long (part of the) night.
إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا (27)
Surely these love the transitory and neglect a grievous day before them.
نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا (28)
We created them and made firm their make, and when We please We will bring in their place the likes of them by a change.
إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا (29)
Surely this is a reminder, so whoever pleases takes to his Lord a way.
وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا (30)
And you do not please except that Allah please, surely Allah is Knowing, Wise;
يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا (31)
He makes whom He pleases to enter into His mercy; and (as for) the unjust, He has prepared for them a painful chastisement.

A81.Title: 77: Al-Mursalaat المرسلات
A81.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
وَٱلْمُرْسَلَٰتِ عُرْفًا (1)
I swear by the emissary winds, sent one after another (for men's benefit),
فَٱلْعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصْفًا (2)
By the raging hurricanes,
وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشْرًا (3)
Which scatter clouds to their destined places,
فَٱلْفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرْقًا (4)
Then separate them one from another,
فَٱلْمُلْقِيَٰتِ ذِكْرًا (5)
Then I swear by the angels who bring down the revelation,
عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا (6)
To clear or to warn.
إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٌ (7)
Most surely what you are threatened with must come to pass.
فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ (8)
So when the stars are made to lose their light,
وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتْ (9)
And when the heaven is rent asunder,
وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ (10)
And when the mountains are carried away as dust,
وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ (11)
And when the apostles are gathered at their appointed time
لِأَىِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ (12)
To what day is the doom fixed?
لِيَوْمِ ٱلْفَصْلِ (13)
To the day of decision.
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ (14)
And what will make you comprehend what the day of decision is?
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (15)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ (16)
Did We not destroy the former generations?
ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ (17)
Then did We follow them up with later ones.
كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ (18)
Even thus shall We deal with the guilty.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (19)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
أَلَمْ نَخْلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٍ مَّهِينٍ (20)
Did We not create you from contemptible water?
فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ فِى قَرَارٍ مَّكِينٍ (21)
Then We placed it in a secure resting-place,
إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ (22)
Till an appointed term,
فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ ٱلْقَٰدِرُونَ (23)
So We proportion it-- how well are We at proportioning (things).
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (24)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا (25)
Have We not made the earth to draw together to itself,
أَحْيَآءً وَأَمْوَٰتًا (26)
The living and the dead,
وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ شَٰمِخَٰتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَٰكُم مَّآءً فُرَاتًا (27)
And made therein lofty mountains, and given you to drink of sweet water?
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (28)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ (29)
Walk on to that which you called a lie.
ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِى ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٍ (30)
Walk on to the covering having three branches,
لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ (31)
Neither having the coolness of the shade nor availing against the flame.
إِنَّهَا تَرْمِى بِشَرَرٍ كَٱلْقَصْرِ (32)
Surely it sends up sparks like palaces,
كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٌ صُفْرٌ (33)
As if they were tawny camels.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (34)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
هَٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ (35)
This is the day on which they shall not speak,
وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ (36)
And permission shall not be given to them so that they should offer excuses.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (37)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
هَٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ جَمَعْنَٰكُمْ وَٱلْأَوَّلِينَ (38)
This is the day of decision: We have gathered you and those of yore.
فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ (39)
So if you have a plan, plan against Me (now).
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (40)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى ظِلَٰلٍ وَعُيُونٍ (41)
Surely those who guard (against evil) shall be amid shades and fountains,
وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ (42)
And fruits such as they desire.
كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ (43)
Eat and drink pleasantly because of what you did.
إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ (44)
Surely thus do We reward the doers of good.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (45)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
كُلُوا۟ وَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجْرِمُونَ (46)
Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little; surely you are guilty.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (47)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرْكَعُوا۟ لَا يَرْكَعُونَ (48)
And where it is said to them: Bow down, they do not bow down.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (49)
Woe on that day to the rejecters.
فَبِأَىِّ حَدِيثٍۭ بَعْدَهُۥ يُؤْمِنُونَ (50)
In what announcement, then, after it, will they believe?

A82.Title: 78: An-Naba النبإ
A82.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ (1)
Of what do they ask one another?
عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ (2)
About the great event,
ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ (3)
About which they differ?
كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ (4)
Nay! they shall soon come to know
ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ (5)
Nay! Nay! they shall soon know.
أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِهَٰدًا (6)
Have We not made the earth an even expanse?
وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا (7)
And the mountains as projections (thereon)?
وَخَلَقْنَٰكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا (8)
And We created you in pairs,
وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا (9)
And We made your sleep to be rest (to you),
وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا (10)
And We made the night to be a covering,
وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا (11)
And We made the day for seeking livelihood.
وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا (12)
And We made above you seven strong ones,
وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا (13)
And We made a shining lamp,
وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمُعْصِرَٰتِ مَآءً ثَجَّاجًا (14)
And We send down from the clouds water pouring forth abundantly,
لِّنُخْرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا (15)
That We may bring forth thereby corn and herbs,
وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلْفَافًا (16)
And gardens dense and luxuriant.
إِنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتًا (17)
Surely the day of decision is (a day) appointed:
يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا (18)
The day on which the trumpet shall be blown so you shall come forth in hosts,
وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَٰبًا (19)
And the heaven shall be opened so that it shall be all openings,
وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا (20)
And the mountains shall be moved off so that they shall remain a mere semblance.
إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا (21)
Surely hell lies in wait,
لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابًا (22)
A place of resort for the inordinate,
لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحْقَابًا (23)
Living therein for ages.
لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا (24)
They shall not taste therein cool nor drink
إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا (25)
But boiling and intensely cold water,
جَزَآءً وِفَاقًا (26)
Requital corresponding.
إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا (27)
Surely they feared not the account,
وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابًا (28)
And called Our communications a lie, giving the lie (to the truth).
وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَٰهُ كِتَٰبًا (29)
And We have recorded everything in a book,
فَذُوقُوا۟ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا (30)
So taste! for We will not add to you aught but chastisement.
إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا (31)
Surely for those who guard (against evil) is achievement,
حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعْنَٰبًا (32)
Gardens and vineyards,
وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا (33)
And voluptuous women of equal age;
وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا (34)
And a pure cup.
لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّٰبًا (35)
They shall not hear therein any vain words nor lying.
جَزَآءً مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابًا (36)
A reward from your Lord, a gift according to a reckoning:
رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا (37)
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Beneficent Allah, they shall not be able to address Him.
يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفًّا لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا (38)
The day on which the spirit and the angels shall stand in ranks; they shall not speak except he whom the Beneficent Allah permits and who speaks the right thing.
ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا (39)
That is the sure day, so whoever desires may take refuge with his Lord.
إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَٰكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى كُنتُ تُرَٰبًۢا (40)
Surely We have warned you of a chastisement near at hand: the day when man shall see what his two hands have sent before, and the unbeliever shall say: O! would that I were dust!

A83.Title: 79: An-Naazi'aat النازعات
A83.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرْقًا (1)
I swear by the angels who violently pull out the souls of the wicked,
وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشْطًا (2)
And by those who gently draw out the souls of the blessed,
وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبْحًا (3)
And by those who float in space,
فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبْقًا (4)
Then those who are foremost going ahead,
فَٱلْمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمْرًا (5)
Then those who regulate the affair.
يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ (6)
The day on which the quaking one shall quake,
تَتْبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ (7)
What must happen afterwards shall follow it.
قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ (8)
Hearts on that day shall palpitate,
أَبْصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٌ (9)
Their eyes cast down.
يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِى ٱلْحَافِرَةِ (10)
They say: Shall we indeed be restored to (our) first state?
أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمًا نَّخِرَةً (11)
What! when we are rotten bones?
قَالُوا۟ تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ (12)
They said: That then would be a return occasioning loss.
فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ (13)
But it shall be only a single cry,
فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ (14)
When lo! they shall be wakeful.
هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ (15)
Has not there come to you the story of Musa?
إِذْ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى (16)
When his Lord called upon him in the holy valley, twice,
ٱذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ (17)
Go to Firon, surely he has become inordinate.
فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ (18)
Then say: Have you (a desire) to purify yourself:
وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ (19)
And I will guide you to your Lord so that you should fear.
فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلْءَايَةَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ (20)
So he showed him the mighty sign.
فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ (21)
But he rejected (the truth) and disobeyed.
ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ (22)
Then he went back hastily.
فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ (23)
Then he gathered (men) and called out.
فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ (24)
Then he said: I am your lord, the most high.
فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ وَٱلْأُولَىٰٓ (25)
So Allah seized him with the punishment of the hereafter and the former life.
إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰٓ (26)
Most surely there is in this a lesson to him who fears.
ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بَنَىٰهَا (27)
Are you the harder to create or the heaven? He made it.
رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا (28)
He raised high its height, then put it into a right good state.
وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا (29)
And He made dark its night and brought out its light.
وَٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ (30)
And the earth, He expanded it after that.
أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرْعَىٰهَا (31)
He brought forth from it its water and its pasturage.
وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَرْسَىٰهَا (32)
And the mountains, He made them firm,
مَتَٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَٰمِكُمْ (33)
A provision for you and for your cattle.
فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ (34)
But when the great predominating calamity comes;
يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ (35)
The day on which man shall recollect what he strove after,
وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ (36)
And the hell shall be made manifest to him who sees
فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ (37)
Then as for him who is inordinate,
وَءَاثَرَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا (38)
And prefers the life of this world,
فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ (39)
Then surely the hell, that is the abode.
وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ (40)
And as for him who fears to stand in the presence of his Lord and forbids the soul from low desires,
فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَنَّةَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ (41)
Then surely the garden-- that is the abode.
يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَىٰهَا (42)
They ask you about the hour, when it will come.
فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكْرَىٰهَآ (43)
About what! You are one to remind of it.
إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ (44)
To your Lord is the goal of it.
إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰهَا (45)
You are only a warner to him who would fear it.
كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَىٰهَا (46)
On the day that they see it, it will be as though they had not tarried but the latter part of a day or the early part of it.

A84.Title: 80: Abasa عبس
A84.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ (1)
He frowned and turned (his) back,
أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ (2)
Because there came to him the blind man.
وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ (3)
And what would make you know that he would purify himself,
أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰٓ (4)
Or become reminded so that the reminder should profit him?
أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰ (5)
As for him who considers himself free from need (of you),
فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ (6)
To him do you address yourself.
وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ (7)
And no blame is on you if he would not purify himself
وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ (8)
And as to him who comes to you striving hard,
وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ (9)
And he fears,
فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ (10)
From him will you divert yourself.
كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ (11)
Nay! surely it is an admonishment.
فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ (12)
So let him who pleases mind it.
فِى صُحُفٍ مُّكَرَّمَةٍ (13)
In honored books,
مَّرْفُوعَةٍ مُّطَهَّرَةٍۭ (14)
Exalted, purified,
بِأَيْدِى سَفَرَةٍ (15)
In the hands of scribes
كِرَامٍۭ بَرَرَةٍ (16)
Noble, virtuous.
قُتِلَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكْفَرَهُۥ (17)
Cursed be man! how ungrateful is he!
مِنْ أَىِّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ (18)
Of what thing did He create him?
مِن نُّطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ (19)
Of a small seed; He created him, then He made him according to a measure,
ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ (20)
Then (as for) the way-- He has made it easy (for him)
ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقْبَرَهُۥ (21)
Then He causes him to die, then assigns to him a grave,
ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ (22)
Then when He pleases, He will raise him to life again.
كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ (23)
Nay; but he has not done what He bade him.
فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ (24)
Then let man look to his food,
أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا ٱلْمَآءَ صَبًّا (25)
That We pour down the water, pouring (it) down in abundance,
ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ شَقًّا (26)
Then We cleave the earth, cleaving (it) asunder,
فَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا (27)
Then We cause to grow therein the grain,
وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا (28)
And grapes and clover,
وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا (29)
And the olive and the palm,
وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلْبًا (30)
And thick gardens,
وَفَٰكِهَةً وَأَبًّا (31)
And fruits and herbage
مَّتَٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَٰمِكُمْ (32)
A provision for you and for your cattle.
فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ (33)
But when the deafening cry comes,
يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ (34)
The day on which a man shall fly from his brother,
وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ (35)
And his mother and his father,
وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ (36)
And his spouse and his son--
لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ (37)
Every man of them shall on that day have an affair which will occupy him.
وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّسْفِرَةٌ (38)
(Many) faces on that day shall be bright,
ضَاحِكَةٌ مُّسْتَبْشِرَةٌ (39)
Laughing, joyous.
وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ (40)
And (many) faces on that day, on them shall be dust,
تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ (41)
Darkness shall cover them.
أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَفَرَةُ ٱلْفَجَرَةُ (42)
These are they who are unbelievers, the wicked.

A85.Title: 81: At-Takwir التكوير
A85.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ (1)
When the sun is covered,
وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتْ (2)
And when the stars darken,
وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ (3)
And when the mountains are made to pass away,
وَإِذَا ٱلْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ (4)
And when the camels are left untended,
وَإِذَا ٱلْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ (5)
And when the wild animals are made to go forth,
وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ (6)
And when the seas are set on fire,
وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ (7)
And when souls are united,
وَإِذَا ٱلْمَوْءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتْ (8)
And when the female infant buried alive is asked
بِأَىِّ ذَنۢبٍ قُتِلَتْ (9)
For what sin she was killed,
وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ (10)
And when the books are spread,
وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتْ (11)
And when the heaven has its covering removed,
وَإِذَا ٱلْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ (12)
And when the hell is kindled up,
وَإِذَا ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ (13)
And when the garden is brought nigh,
عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أَحْضَرَتْ (14)
Every soul shall (then) know what it has prepared.
فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلْخُنَّسِ (15)
But nay! I swear by the stars,
ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْكُنَّسِ (16)
That run their course (and) hide themselves,
وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ (17)
And the night when it departs,
وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ (18)
And the morning when it brightens,
إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ (19)
Most surely it is the Word of an honored messenger,
ذِى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ (20)
The processor of strength, having an honorable place with the Lord of the Dominion,
مُّطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ (21)
One (to be) obeyed, and faithful in trust.
وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجْنُونٍ (22)
And your companion is not gone mad.
وَلَقَدْ رَءَاهُ بِٱلْأُفُقِ ٱلْمُبِينِ (23)
And of a truth he saw himself on the clear horizon.
وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ (24)
Nor of the unseen is he a tenacious concealer.
وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَٰنٍ رَّجِيمٍ (25)
Nor is it the word of the cursed Shaitan,
فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ (26)
Whither then will you go?
إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَٰلَمِينَ (27)
It is naught but a reminder for the nations,
لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَسْتَقِيمَ (28)
For him among you who pleases to go straight.
وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ (29)
And you do not please except that Allah please, the Lord of the worlds.

A86.Title: 82: Al-Infitaar الإنفطار
A86.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتْ (1)
When the heaven becomes cleft asunder,
وَإِذَا ٱلْكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتْ (2)
And when the stars become dispersed,
وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ (3)
And when the seas are made to flow forth,
وَإِذَا ٱلْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ (4)
And when the graves are laid open,
عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ (5)
Every soul shall know what it has sent before and held back.
يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ (6)
O man! what has beguiled you from your Lord, the Gracious one,
ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ (7)
Who created you, then made you complete, then made you symmetrical?
فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ (8)
Into whatever form He pleased He constituted you.
كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ (9)
Nay! but you give the lie to the judgment day,
وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَٰفِظِينَ (10)
And most surely there are keepers over you
كِرَامًا كَٰتِبِينَ (11)
Honorable recorders,
ي��عْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ (12)
They know what you do.
إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ (13)
Most surely the righteous are in bliss,
وَإِنَّ ٱلْفُجَّارَ لَفِى جَحِيمٍ (14)
And most surely the wicked are in burning fire,
يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ (15)
They shall enter it on the day of judgment.
وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ (16)
And they shall by no means be absent from it.
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ (17)
And what will make you realize what the day of judgment is?
ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ (18)
Again, what will make you realize what the day of judgment is?
يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِّنَفْسٍ شَيْـًٔا وَٱلْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ (19)
The day on which no soul shall control anything for (another) soul; and the command on that day shall be entirely Allah's.

A87.Title: 83: Al-Mutaffifin المطففين
A87.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ (1)
Woe to the defrauders,
ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ (2)
Who, when they take the measure (of their dues) from men take it fully,
وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ (3)
But when they measure out to others or weigh out for them, they are deficient.
أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ (4)
Do not these think that they shall be raised again
لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ (5)
For a mighty day,
يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ (6)
The day on which men shall stand before the Lord of the worlds?
كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ (7)
Nay! most surely the record of the wicked is in the Sijjin.
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ (8)
And what will make you know what the Sijjin is?
كِتَٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ (9)
It is a written book.
وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ (10)
Woe on that day to the rejecters,
ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ (11)
Who give the lie to the day of judgment.
وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ (12)
And none gives the lie to it but every exceeder of limits, sinful one
إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ (13)
When Our communications are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore.
كَلَّا بَلْ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ (14)
Nay! rather, what they used to do has become like rust upon their hearts.
كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ (15)
Nay! most surely they shall on that day be debarred from their Lord.
ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُوا۟ ٱلْجَحِيمِ (16)
Then most surely they shall enter the burning fire.
ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ (17)
Then shall it be said: This is what you gave the lie to.
كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ (18)
Nay! Most surely the record of the righteous shall be in the Iliyin.
وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ (19)
And what will make you know what the highest Iliyin is?
كِتَٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ (20)
It is a written book,
يَشْهَدُهُ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ (21)
Those who are drawn near (to Allah) shall witness it.
إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ (22)
Most surely the righteous shall be in bliss,
عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ (23)
On thrones, they shall gaze;
تَعْرِفُ فِى وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ (24)
You will recognize in their faces the brightness of bliss.
يُسْقَوْنَ مِن رَّحِيقٍ مَّخْتُومٍ (25)
They are made to quaff of a pure drink that is sealed (to others).
خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ (26)
The sealing of it is (with) musk; and for that let the aspirers aspire.
وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسْنِيمٍ (27)
And the admixture of it is a water of Tasnim,
عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ (28)
A fountain from which drink they who are drawn near (to Allah).
إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ (29)
Surely they who are guilty used to laugh at those who believe.
وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ (30)
And when they passed by them, they winked at one another.
وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ (31)
And when they returned to their own followers they returned exulting.
وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ (32)
And when they saw them, they said: Most surely these are in error;
وَمَآ أُرْسِلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ حَٰفِظِينَ (33)
And they were not sent to be keepers over them.
فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ (34)
So today those who believe shall laugh at the unbelievers;
عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ (35)
On thrones, they will look.
هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ (36)
Surely the disbelievers are rewarded as they did.

A88.Title: 84: Al-Inshiqaaq الإنشقاق
A88.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتْ (1)
When the heaven bursts asunder,
وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ (2)
And obeys its Lord and it must.
وَإِذَا ٱلْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ (3)
And when the earth is stretched,
وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ (4)
And casts forth what is in it and becomes empty,
وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ (5)
And obeys its Lord and it must.
يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ (6)
O man! surely you must strive (to attain) to your Lord, a hard striving until you meet Him.
فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ (7)
Then as to him who is given his book in his right hand,
فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا (8)
He shall be reckoned with by an easy reckoning,
وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا (9)
And he shall go back to his people joyful.
وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ (10)
And as to him who is given his book behind his back,
فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُوا۟ ثُبُورًا (11)
He shall call for perdition,
وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا (12)
And enter into burning fire.
إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِىٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا (13)
Surely he was (erstwhile) joyful among his followers.
إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ (14)
Surely he thought that he would never return.
بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرًا (15)
Yea! surely his Lord does ever see him.
فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ (16)
But nay! I swear by the sunset redness,
وَٱلَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ (17)
And the night and that which it drives on,
وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ (18)
And the moon when it grows full,
لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٍ (19)
That you shall most certainly enter one state after another.
فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ (20)
But what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ (21)
And when the Quran is recited to them they do not make obeisance?
بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُكَذِّبُونَ (22)
Nay! those who disbelieve give the lie to the truth.
وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ (23)
And Allah knows best what they hide,
فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ (24)
So announce to them a painful punishment~
إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۭ (25)
Except those who believe and do good; for them is a reward that shall never be cut off.

A89.Title: 85: Al-Burooj البروج
A89.Data:
بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْبُرُوجِ (1)
I swear by the mansions of the stars,
وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْمَوْعُودِ (2)
And the promised day,
وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ (3)
And the bearer of witness and those against whom the witness is borne.
قُتِلَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْأُخْدُودِ (4)
Cursed be the makers of the pit,
ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلْوَقُودِ (5)
Of the fire (kept burning) with fuel,
إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ (6)
When they sat by it,
وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ (7)
And they were witnesses of what they did with the believers.
وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ (8)
And they did not take vengeance on them for aught except that they believed in Allah, the Mighty, the Praised,
ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ (9)
Whose is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is a Witness of all things.
إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ (10)
Surely (as for) those who persecute the believing men and the believing women, then do not repent, they shall have the chastisement of hell, and they shall have the chastisement of burning.
إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ (11)
Surely (as for) those who believe and do good, they shall have gardens beneath which rivers flow, that is the great achievement.
إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ (12)
Surely the might of your Lord is great.
إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ (13)
Surely He it is Who originates and reproduces,
وَهُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلْوَدُودُ (14)
And He is the Forgiving, the Loving,
ذُو ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْمَجِيدُ (15)
Lord of the Arsh, the Glorious,
فَعَّالٌ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ (16)
The great doer of what He will.
